Description: TO BE ABLE TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO THE EMERGENCY AND ONGOING MATERIAL ASSISTANCE NEEDS OF JEWISH HUMANITARIAN MIGRANTS FROM THE FORMER SOVIET UNION, EASTERN EUROPE, AFRICA, THE NEAR EAST AND OTHER COUNTRIES OF DISTRESS.

REDUCE THE RISK OF GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE (GBV) AND CHILD PROTECTION (CP) VIOLATIONS THROUGH COMPREHENSIVE MENTAL HEALTH AND PSYCHOSOCIAL (MHPSS), ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT, LEGAL ASSISTANCE AND COMMUNITY-BASED ACTIVITIES
ADVANCE LOCALIZATION AND HUMANITARIAN PROTECTION IN THE KURDISTAN REGION OF IRAQ.
THIS PROGRAM WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ENHANCING THE RESILIENCE OF REFUGEES AND HOST COUNTRY NATIONALS IN LEBANON, BY SUPPORTING THEIR MENTAL HEALTH AND PSYCHOSOCIAL WELLBEING.
IMPROVE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF BENEFICIARIES, WHILE STRENGTHENING SOCIAL COHESION AMONG REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN TURKIYE

IMPROVE ACCESS TO QUALITY, INCLUSIVE, SAFE, AND INTEGRATED FORMAL AND NON-FORMAL EDUCATION SERVICES FOR OUT-OF-SCHOOL REFUGEE AND JORDANIAN BOYS AND GIRLS THROUGH IDENTIFYING AND MITIGATING THE BARRIERS AT THE INDIVIDUAL, CLASSROOM, AND COMMUNITY LEVELS

ESTABLISHING AND SUSTAINING A LEGAL CENTER FOR EXPERTISE IN MIGRATION AND ASYLUM FOR PROTECTION SEEKERS AND FOR REFUGEE LAW ADVOCATES THAT ULTIMATELY AIM TO EMPOWER AND EXTEND SOLIDARITY TO REFUGEES AND VULNERABLE MIGRANTS IN TURKIYE
UNREGISTERED AND NEWLY REGISTERED BURMESE POPULATION OF CONCERN (POC) HAVE CONTINUED ACCESS TO EDUCATION AND GREATER PROTECTION AID THAT SAFEGUARDS THEIR DEVELOPMENT WELLBEING.

TO BE ABLE TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO THE EMERGENCY AND ONGOING MATERIAL ASSISTANCE NEEDS OF JEWISH HUMANITARIAN MIGRANTS FROM THE FORMER SOVIET UNION, EASTERN EUROPE, AFRICA, THE NEAR EAST AND OTHER COUNTRIES OF DISTRESS.

PROVIDING SPECIALIZED HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN TURKEY WHILE STRENGTHENING THEIR RESILIENCE AND CONTRIBUTING TO THEIR WELLBEING THROUGH INTEGRATED REHABILITATION, COMMUNITY AND MENTAL HEALTH AND PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT SERVICES
TO ENHANCE DURABLE SOLUTIONS THROUGH STRENGTHENING SELF-RELIANCE OF DISPLACEMENT AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN DOHUK AND SALAH AL DIN GOVERNORATES OF IRAQ.
TO MITIGATE AND ADDRESS THE PROTECTION IMPACT OF COVID-19 ON THE MOST VULNERABLE WOMEN, MEN, BOYS AND GIRLS FROM REFUGEE AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN THE BEKAA AND NABATIEH GOVERNORATES OF LEBANON.

IMPROVE LEARNING OUTCOMES FOR SYRIAN REFUGEE AND LEBANESE CHILDREN BY INCREASING ACCESS, RETENTION, AND QUALITY OF SUPPORTIVE EDUCATION SERVICES, AND SUPPORT CHILDREN, PARENTS, AND CAREGIVERS WITH MHPSS AND LEGAL ASSISTANCE SERVICES.
PROMOTING SELF-RELIANCE AND SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS OPPORTUNITIES FOR AT-RISK CONFLICT AND DISPLACEMENT AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS TO MITIGATE KEY PROTECTION RISKS IN IRAQ.
TO ENHANCE DURABLE SOLUTIONS, SAFETY, AND SELF-RELIANCE FOR VULNERABLE SYRIAN REFUGEES IN IRAQ THROUGH IMPROVED SHELTERS, CAMP INFRASTRUCTURE, AND ACCESS TO LIVELIHOOD OPPORTUNITIES
IDPS AND RETURNEES IN DUHOK AND NINEWA GOVERNORATES DEVELOP LONG-TERM DURABLE SOLUTIONS TO RECOVER FROM THE CONFLICT WITH ISIS IN IRAQ
IMPROVING THE SAFETY AND PSYCHOLOGICAL WELLBEING OF VULNERABLE GIRLS, WOMEN, BOYS AND MEN IN KRI
PREVENT GBV, AND PROTECT, EMPOWER AND SUPPORT SURVIVORS AND VULNERABLE AND CONFLICT AFFECTED POPULATIONS TO ADDRESS PROTECTION RISKS AND SUPPORT DURABLE SOLUTIONS IN KURDISTAN REGION OF IRAQ.
TO CONTRIBUTE TO SYRIAN AND JORDANIAN CHILDREN AND YOUTH'S PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT, EMPLOYABILITY AND WELLBEING THROUGH INCREASING SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF SECONDARY EDUCATION.
IRAQI IDPS, RETURNEES, AND VULNERABLE HOST COMMUNITIES, PARTICULARLY WOMEN, ARE SAFE, RESILIENT, AND ABLE TO ACCESS THEIR RIGHTS.
TO SUSTAIN THE WELL-BEING OF REFUGEES AND ASYLUM SEEKERS IN URBAN SITES AND IMMIGRATION DETENTION CENTERS, FOR IMPROVING ACCESS TO BASIC HEALTH CARE.
PROVISION OF PROTECTION SERVICES TO CONFLICT AFFECTED SYRIAN REFUGEES IN IRAQ
IMPROVE AND PROVIDE PROTECTION MECHANISMS IN KIRIKKALE, ESKISEHIR, AND YALOVA FOR SYRIAN AND NON-SYRIAN ASYLUM SEEKERS AND REFUGEES IN TURKEY
CONFLICT AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS IN IRAQ ACHIEVE DURABLE SOLUTIONS IN AREAS OF DISPLACEMENT AND RETURN.
PREPARE FOR, MITIGATE, AND ADDRESS THE IMPACT OF COVID-19 ON THE SOCIO-ECONOMIC STATUS AND MENTAL WELLBEING OF VULNERABLE REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN JORDAN.

IMPROVED ACCESS TO INTEGRATED HEALTH, MENTAL HEALTH, PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT (MHPSS) AND GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE GBV) PREVENTION AND RESPONSE SERVICES FOR SYRIAN REFUGEES AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN LEBANON, INCLUDING PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES (PWD).
TO PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS OF VULNERABLE JORDANIAN AND SYRIAN HOUSEHOLDS THROUGH INTEGRATED FARMING AS AN ECONOMIC RECOVERY MECHANISM IN CENTRAL AND NORTHERN JORDAN.
IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF REFUGEES AND VULNERABLE JORDANIANS WITH HEARING, VISUAL, AND INTELLECTUAL IMPAIRMENTS AND DISABILITIES.
TO SUPPORT MEDAIR'S FY 2022 PROJECT TO INCREASE LIFE-SAVING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT FOR REFUGEES IN JORDAN
IMPROVE THE SELF-RELIANCE AND RESILIENCE OF REFUGEES AND VULNERABLE LEBANESE IN LEBANON; ESPECIALLY PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, WOMEN, AND YOUTH
TO ADDRESS PROTECTION NEEDS OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES (PWDS) AMONG REFUGEES FROM SYRIA (RFS) AND THEIR PEERS IN HOST COMMUNITIES (LHCS) BY FILLING GAPS IN BASIC REHABILITATION SERVICES.

TO SUPPORT VULNERABLE AND AT-RISK INDIVIDUALS, HOUSEHOLDS AND COMMUNITIES IN LEBANON BY MITIGATING THE EXPOSURE TO PROTECTION RISKS THROUGH ENHANCED RESILIENCE AND BETTER ACCESS TO THEIR RIGHTS INCLUDING TO SAFE AND DECENT LIVING CONDITIONS
DEPRIVED SYRIAN REFUGEE AND LEBANESE CHILDREN BUILD RESILIENCE BY IMPROVING THEIR EDUCATION COMPETENCIES, PSYCHOSOCIAL WELLBEING AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS.
TO PROVIDE LIVELIHOODS AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT SERVICES TO REFUGEE AND HOST COMMUNITY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED ENTERPRISES IN TURKEY.
CONTRIBUTE TO BUILDING MORE INCLUSIVE COMMUNITIES, ALLOWING CRISIS-AFFECTED SYRIANS AND MOST VULNERABLE JORDANIANS TO REACH THEIR POTENTIAL.
STRENGTHEN THE SOCIO ECONOMIC RESILIENCE OF VULNERABLE RETURNEES, IDPS AND THE HOST COMMUNITY IN NINAWA AND DUHOK GOVERNORATES.
ENSURE ACCESS TO JUSTICE FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE REFUGEES AND EMPOWERMENT OF REFUGEE COMMUNITIES; CONTRIBUTE TO STRENGTHENING THE RESILIENCE OF THE TURKISH PROTECTION SYSTEM.

TO PROVIDE SPECIALIZED HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN ANKARA, HATAY, AND ISTANBUL WHILE STRENGTHENING THEIR RESILIENCE AND CONTRIBUTING TO THEIR WELLBEING THROUGH INTEGRATED REHABILITATION, COMMUNITY AND MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT SERVICES
TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF BENEFICIARIES, WHILE STRENGTHENING THE SOCIAL COHESION AMONG REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN TURKEY.
TO BRIDGE THE GAP BETWEEN THE REFUGEE COMMUNITY AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM BY ENSURING SAFE ACCESS TO HEALTH AND BASIC SERVICES FOR REFUGEES WITH DISABILITIES IN TURKEY.

IMPROVE ACCESS TO QUALITY, INCLUSIVE, SAFE AND INTEGRATED NON-FORMAL EDUCATION SERVICES FOR OUT OF SCHOOL REFUGEE AND JORDANIAN BOYS AND GIRLS THROUGH IDENTIFYING AND MITIGATING THE BARRIERS AT THE INDIVIDUAL, CLASSROOM, AND COMMUNITY LEVELS.
ENHANCED RECOVERY CAPACITIES AND SELF-RELIANCE OF REFUGEES AND DISPLACEMENT-AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN JORDAN THROUGH INTEGRATED PROTECTION AND LIVELIHOODS ASSISTANCE, AND LOCAL PARTNERSHIPS.
IMPROVING THE WELLBEING OF REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITY POPULATIONS THROUGH MENTAL HEALTH AND CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES.

ADOLESCENT GIRLS AND YOUNG WOMEN AT RISK AND/OR AFFECTED BY CHILD AND EARLY MARRIAGE ARE BETTER PROTECTED THROUGH HAVING ACCESS TO QUALITY TAILORED AND INTEGRATED CP AND GBV RESPONSE, PREVENTION AND MULTI-SECTORAL SERVICES IN LEBANON.
INCREASED EQUITABLE AND SUSTAINED ACCESS TO EDUCATION AND PROTECTION FOR REFUGEE AND HOST COMMUNITY GIRLS AND BOYS WHO ARE OUT OF SCHOOL OR AT RISK OF SCHOOL DROPOUT IN HATAY PROVINCE, TURKEY.
IMPROVE SOCIO-ECONOMIC RESILIENCE & LIVELIHOOD OPPORTUNITIES AMONG WOMEN, REFUGEE & HOST COMMUNITY YOUTH IN TURKEY THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS TO SKILLS TRAINING, NETWORKING AND EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT.

IMPROVE ACCESS TO QUALITY, INCLUSIVE, SAFE AND INTEGRATED NON-FORMAL EDUCATION SERVICES FOR OUT OF SCHOOL REFUGEE AND JORDANIAN BOYS AND GIRLS THROUGH IDENTIFYING AND MITIGATING THE BARRIERS AT THE INDIVIDUAL, CLASSROOM, AND COMMUNITY LEVELS
TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH STATUS OF SYRIAN, IRAQI, AND OTHER REFUGEE GROUPS, AND HOST COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN LEBANON.
REFUGEES AND VULNERABLE HOST COMMUNITIES IN JORDAN ARE SAFE, HEALTHIER, MORE RESILIENT AND PROTECTED FROM HARM.

TO SUPPORT SYRIAN AND NON-SYRIAN COMMUNITIES RESIDING IN RURAL AND URBAN SETTINGS OF OPERATIONAL PROVINCES IN TURKEY TO ENSURING THEY HAVE ENHANCED PROTECTION AND RESILIENCE THROUGH PROACTIVE FACILITATION OF THEIR ACCESS TO SERVICES

A SCALABLE, PARTNERSHIP-BASED APPROACH TO PROMOTE INDIVIDUAL, FAMILY, AND COMMUNITY REHABILITATION, RESILIENCE, AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING OF TARGET POPULATIONS IN JORDAN.

INCREASE RESILIENCE AND CAPACITY OF VULNERABLE SYRIAN AND OTHER REFUGEES, REGISTERED AND UNREGISTERED MIGRANTS, AS WELL AS VULNERABLE HOST COMMUNITIES IN TURKEY TO MEET BASIC NEEDS, CLAIM THEIR RIGHTS, AND COPE WITH SHOCKS AND STRESSES
ACTED WILL PROVIDE EQUITABLE AND SUSTAINABLE USE OF WASH MATERIALS, FACILITIES, AND SERVICES FOR CONFLICT AFFECTED REFUGEES RESIDING IN GAWILAN CAMP IN KRI.

IMPROVE LEARNING OUTCOMES FOR SYRIAN REFUGEE CHILDREN BY INCREASING ACCESS, RETENTION, AND QUALITY OF SUPPORTIVE EDUCATION SERVICES AND SUPPORTING SYRIAN REFUGEE PARENTS AND CAREGIVERS WITH LEGAL INFORMATION AND LEGAL ASSISTANCE SERVICES.

CONTRIBUTE TO THE INCREASE OF LIFE-SAVING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT FOR REFUGEES IN JORDAN.
